intro: Calysaccion harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand's calysaccion, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
